p: In our study, the total mean cost per mother-baby pair was USD 441.9 (range: 422.5–502.6) which is congruent with findings from a study conducted in Ethiopia in urban high HIV prevalence health facilities [ 33]. The Ethiopian study reported that the cost of providing a PMTCT service per woman-infant pair ranged from USD 319 to USD 1099 (2014 cost prices). Correspondingly, another study conducted in Namibia and Rwanda during the pre-Option B+ era found the cost per mother-infant pair in Namibia in the range of USD 203–1030, (2009 cost prices) which is comparable to the current study [ 34]. The wide range in the cost per mother-infant pair could be due the differences in the PMTCT packages in the Ethiopian and Namibian studies.
